main event: An unidentified object with red lights was observed over Mt. Airy, Maryland, on March 8, 1965.
interesting points: The object was initially seen by an observer and his son who noticed six red lights about 1300 feet away moving at an estimated speed of twenty miles per hour., The lights appeared in a straight line and seemed to blink at times., The sighting lasted approximately three minutes before the lights disappeared over the horizon., An aircraft with a white light was also observed, flying perpendicular to the lights., This case remains classified as 'unidentified' by the Air Force due to a lack of conclusive evidence.
witness description: An observer and his two sons
